_header: Son I shall thee show now take heed
Subjects: instruction, father to son; children, instructions for the behavior of
_description: A Father’s Instructions to his Son — two 12-line (ababababcdcd) and one 14-line stanzas

BLAdd25006.First Lines:
I sale ye teche son tak hedeAnd siche maner to þe
                    declare…
BLAdd25006.Last Lines:
…Lyenge bost gret othis þu fleAnd thus sal þu wyn
                    wilfare

Lam853.First Lines:
SOne y schal þe schewe now take hedeAnd of suche maners
                    þee declareBi whiche þou schalt come to manhedeTowordli
                    worschip and to weelfare…
Lam853.Last Lines:
…Medle not with mysrule by no maner wayffor good maner he
                    haþ from hym schifteffor y haue ofte seen þis in fayÞat
                    fro manye men he haþ manhode refte
Lam853.Editions:
Furnivall,  Frederick James,
                        ed.  
             The Babees Book, etc.
EETS
         o.s. 32 (1868); rev. ed.  Early English Meals and
                Manners London: Trübner, 1876; repr. 1973: orig. ed. 34-5.
